units.title: Organoid culture
units.text: 1 Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: Initial step to grow organoids before any treatment.

units.title: S‑phase cell labeling
units.text: 2 Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a ﬁnal concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Labels cells in S phase for later identification.

units.title: Protease and phosphatase inhibitor treatment
units.text: 3 Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Preserves protein and phosphorylation epitopes before fixation.

units.title: Fixation and live/dead staining
units.text:
4 Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
5 Remove PFA solution by pipetting, taking care not to disturb the Matrigel. Wash the cells with PBS on a rocker (speed set at ~45 rpm throughout the protocol) for 10 min at room temperature (~20 °C). Repeat the wash.
6 Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
7 Remove the 194cisplatin solution by pipetting. Wash cells with PBS on a rocker for 10 min at room temperature. Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: Fixes cells in situ and stains dead cells for discrimination.

units.title: TOBis barcoding and quenching
units.text:
8 Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
9 Remove the barcoding solutions by pipetting and wash the cells with 200 µl of 2 mM glutathione/ CSB for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash twice.
10 Wash the cells with 200 µl of PBS for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: Applies unique metal barcodes to each sample and quenches excess reagent.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation
units.text:
11 Make up a dissociation solution of fresh 0.5 mg/ml dispase II, 0.2 mg/ml collagenase IV and 0.2 mg/ ml DNase I in PBS at room temperature.
12 Remove PBS from the wells by pipetting and add the dissociation solution.
13 Scrape Matrigel droplets and pool all cells from all conditions with dissociation solution to a gentleMACS C-Tube. Top up the dissociation solution to 5 ml/C-Tube.
14 Dissociate organoids into single cells by using a gentleMACS Octo dissociator and the ‘Standard protocol’ (see Equipment setup) (Timing: ~50 min).
units.rationale: Breaks organoids into a single‑cell suspension for downstream staining.

units.title: Extracellular antibody staining
units.text:
21 Centrifuge cells at 800g for 5 min at room temperature, discard the supernatant and resuspend cells in 50 µl of CSB.
22 Prepare extracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl).
23 Add the extracellular antibody cocktail to the cells, mix thoroughly by pipetting and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
24 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.

units.title: Permeabilization and intracellular antibody staining
units.text:
25 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of 0.1% (vol/vol) Triton X-100/PBS, gently vortex and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
26 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant. Repeat the wash and remove the supernatant.
27 Place the cells on ice for 1 min.
28 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of ice-cold 50% (vol/vol) methanol/PBS (store at −20 °C until use), gently vortex and incubate for 10 min on ice.
29 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant. Repeat the wash.
30 Resuspend cells in 50 µl of CSB.
31 Prepare intracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl).
32 Add the intracellular antibody cocktail to the cells, mix thoroughly by pipetting and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
33 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
units.rationale: Permeabilizes cells and stains intracellular proteins and PTMs.

units.title: Post‑staining fixation and DNA intercalation
units.text:
34 Add 1 ml of 1.6% (vol/vol) FA/PBS solution made fresh from 16% (vol/vol) FA to the cells and incubate for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature.
35 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
36 Prepare intercalation buffer by diluting 1 µl of 125 µM Cell-ID Intercalator-Ir in 1 ml of Fix & Perm buffer (ﬁnal concentration = 125 nM).
37 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of intercalation buffer, gently vortex and incubate for 1 h on a rocker at room temperature or overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Cross‑links antibodies and incorporates DNA intercalator for mass cytometry.

units.title: Mass cytometry data acquisition and debarcoding
units.text:
38 Tune the Helios mass cytometer (see Equipment setup).
39 Centrifuge cells at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
40 Wash the cells with 2 ml of of 2 mM EDTA/CSB, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
41 Wash cells with 2 ml of CSB, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
42 Wash cells with 2 ml of MaxPar water, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
43 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of MaxPar water, ﬁlter through a 35‑µm cell strainer (70 µm when the culture contains ﬁbroblasts) and count the cells by using a Countess II automated cell counter.
44 Dilute cells to ~0.8–1.2 × 10^6/ml in MaxPar water.
45 Add EQ beads to the cell suspension at a volumetric ratio of 1:5.
46 Add EDTA to the cells to a ﬁnal concentration of 2 mM.
47 Set up the ‘Super Sampler’ (Victorian Airships) as per the manufacturer’s instructions, and set up acquisition parameters (e.g., antibody panel and experiment metadata) on the Helios mass cytometer.
48 Acquire events on the Helios mass cytometer by using the Fluidigm CyTOF software. Aim for 100–400 events/s.
49 After all events are acquired, process the raw data by using the Fluidigm CyTOF software as per Fluidigm’s recommendation (i.e., signal normalization, removal of EQ beads and concatenation of data files if needed). Export data as FCS file(s) (Fig. 6a, Raw.fcs).
50 Debarcode multiplexed FCS file(s) (Fig. 6a, Raw.fcs) into separate experimental conditions by using the MATLAB program Zunder Lab Single Cell Debarcoder (https://github.com/zunderlab/single-cell-debarcoder)44 with user‑defined TOBis barcode keys (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4).
units.rationale: Acquires single‑cell mass cytometry data and separates barcoded samples.
